label: 田楽
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A kind of dance with accompanying songs. At first done at the time when rice fields were planted, in order to amuse the farmers and encourage them in their work, being dancing to the accompaniment of fifes and drums. Later it was performed sometimes apart from rice planting.
